citation.article-title: Bacillus luciferensis sp. nov., from volcanic soil on Candlemas Island, South Sandwich archipelago.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Bacillus luciferensis sp. nov.
Bacillus luciferensis (lu.cif.er.en'sis. N.L. adj. luciferensis referring to Lucifer Hill, a volcano on Candlemas Island, South Sandwich Islands, the soil of which yielded the organism)
Isolated from geothermal soil taken from an active fumarole on Lucifer Hill, a volcano on Candlemas Island, South Sandwich archipelago.
Cells are motile, rounD-ended rods (0.4-0.8¬3-6 lm), occurring singly and in pairs and showing pleomorphism (narrow and broad cells, the latter showing swellings) on TSA MnSO4.
Gram-positive, but becoming Gram-negative within 24 h of culture at 30 °C.

Endospores are apparent in overnight cultures incubated at 30 °C on TSA MnSO4 and are formed in large numbers within 2-3 days of incubation; they are ellipsoidal, lie subterminally and occasionally terminally and may swell the sporangia slightly (Fig. 1).

After 1 day on TSA, colonies are 1-5 mm in diameter, raised, with irregular margins and surfaces, and show some spiking along streak lines; the larger colonies appear to comprise several smaller colonies that have coalesced.

Colonies are moist and loosely butyrous, creamy-grey and translucent with a glossy appearance; by 10x magnification, they show cream and whitish streaking giving an appearance reminiscent of cut glass.
Minimum temperature for growth lies between 15 and 20 °C, the optimum temperature for growth is 30 °C and the maximum growth temperature lies between 35 and 45 °C.
Minimum pH for growth lies between 5.5 and 6.0, the optimum pH for growth is 7.0 and the maximum pH for growth lies between 8.0 and 8.5.
Facultatively anaerobic and weakly catalase-positive.
Casein is hydrolysed, but growth is poor on skim milk medium.

In the API 20E strip, Voges-Proskauer reaction is positive and gelatin is hydrolysed; reactions for o-nitrophenyl β-D-galactopyranoside hydrolysis, arginine dihydrolase, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase, citrate utilization, hydrogen sulphide production, urease, tryptophan deaminase, indole production and nitrate reduction are negative.
Hydrolysis of aesculin is positive.

Acid without gas is produced from the following carbohydrates in the API 50 CH gallery using the CHB suspension medium: amygdalin, arbutin, cellobiose, D-fructose, β-gentiobiose, D-glucose, maltose, D-melezitose, N-acetyl D-glucosamine, salicin, starch (weak), sucrose, dtrehalose and D-turanose.

Acid is not produced from the following carbohydrates: adonitol, D- or larabinose, D- or L-arabitol, dulcitol, erythritol, D- or L-fucose, galactose, gluconate, glycerol, glycogen, meso-inositol, inulin, 2-keto-D-gluconate, 5-keto-dgluconate, lactose, D-lyxose, D-mannitol, D-mannose, melibiose, methyl α-D-glucoside, methyl α-D-mannoside, methyl xyloside, D-raffinose, ribose, rhamnose, sorbitol, L-sorbose, D-tagatose, xylitol or D- or lxylose.

Sensitive to disks of the following antibiotics: ampicillin (25 μg), chloramphenicol (50 μg), colistin sulphate (100 μg), kanamycin (30 μg), nalidixic acid (30 μg), nitrofurantoin (50 μg), streptomycin (25 μg) and tetracycline (100 μg).
The major cellular fatty acids are anteiso C15:0 and iso C15:0 (respectively representing about 25 and 50% of total fatty acid).

The following fatty acids are present in smaller amounts (between about 1.5 and 4.5%): iso C14:0, C14:0, C16:1ω7c alcohol, iso C16:0, C16:1ω11c, C16:0, anteiso C17:0 and C16:1ω9t, while trace but significant amounts of iso C17:0 and of summed feature 5 (C17:1 iso I and/or C17:1 anteiso B) are also present.
Details of the FAME composition are available as supplementary material in IJSEM Online (http ://ijs.sgmjournals.org/).

The G+C content is 33.0 mol% for the type strain, strain LMG 18422T (=CIP 107105T=Logan collection number B1761T=isolate SSI061); the 16S rDNA sequence of this strain is deposited at EMBL under accession number AJ419629.
